snippet: The Capitol Theater in Port Chester, N.Y. — known as a rock stage where acts like the Grateful Dead and Janis Joplin have performed — is set to reopen Sept. 4 after a $2 million renovation by Peter Shapiro.
abstract: Capitol Theater in Port Chester, NY, is set to reopen after a $2 million renovation by Peter Shapiro; theater is known as a rock stage with great acoustics, where acts like the Grateful Dead and Janis Joplin have performed.
lead_paragraph: The Capitol Theater in Port Chester, N.Y. — known as a rock stage where acts like the Grateful Dead and Janis Joplin have performed — is set to reopen Sept. 4 after a $2 million renovation by Peter Shapiro.

headline.seo: Capitol Theater in Port Chester, N.Y., to Reopen
headline.main: A Hall Full of Memory Rocks Out Once More
headline.print_headline: A Hall Full Of Memory Rocks Out Once More
